title: Debilsumda
author: Debilsumda
content: I do recall that coingate used to have it as a option, but i dont find it anymore, and my only way to buy something for lets say 150 dollars top, is by phone bill, like landcall, sms, etc. Or if someone is playing some game which can be donated with phone bill in exchange we can roll. Thanks in advance. Also betting sites are okay if there are some, that accept this way of depositing.

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: You know why you haven't received any response after all those hours? Assuming that everyone knows what DCB means in full. Please try to be clar about what you are asking for. You might find you are even asking in the wrong board.What is DCB for starters?

comments.author: Debilsumda
comments.body: Quote from: Bitcoin_Arena on January 20, 2023, 11:59:54 PMYou know why you haven't received any response after all those hours? Assuming that everyone knows what DCB means in full. Please try to be clar about what you are asking for. You might find you are even asking in the wrong board.What is DCB for starters?DCB=Direct carrier billing, had to wrote it this way

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: Quote from: Debilsumda on January 21, 2023, 01:01:12 AMDCB=Direct carrier billing, had to wrote it this waySo sorry that I can not help, but I suggest you try moving this topic to the service discussion board, you are more likely to get someone who knows a service that offer such options in your area.The option to move your topic is at the bottom left of this page.Also, be careful about strangers who want to contact you in private for a deal. Always use an escrow when trading with untrusted members.

comments.author: Debilsumda
comments.body: Quote from: Bitcoin_Arena on January 21, 2023, 12:24:04 PMQuote from: Debilsumda on January 21, 2023, 01:01:12 AMDCB=Direct carrier billing, had to wrote it this waySo sorry that I can not help, but I suggest you try moving this topic to the service discussion board, you are more likely to get someone who knows a service that offer such options in your area.The option to move your topic is at the bottom left of this page.Also, be careful about strangers who want to contact you in private for a deal. Always use an escrow when trading with untrusted members.Thank you.

comments.author: HmmMAA
comments.body: I haven't heard of such a service before , but from a search I did , I found Fortumo h**ps://nuvei.com/apm/fortumo/ . From what I can see , they offer services in Europe. I'm not certain if that's what you're looking for , but I hope it helps . May I ask why someone would prefer that service over others ?

comments.author: Debilsumda
comments.body: Quote from: HmmMAA on January 21, 2023, 02:35:01 PMI haven't heard of such a service before , but from a search I did , I found Fortumo h**ps://nuvei.com/apm/fortumo/ . From what I can see , they offer services in Europe. I'm not certain if that's what you're looking for , but I hope it helps . May I ask why someone would prefer that service over others ?Because it way easier and you pay your phone bill monthly even 2 months, also this is going to be, next way if sending small amounts of btc or whatever coin, they work on it. In some countries like in India or Africa thats the way they buy coins, idk exactly how they named it but for btc will be i think micro transcactions. I have buyed many times this way from daopay, they worked with coingate, but now services most of them aren't working, and also atm id rather spend some cash which i can pay later, than pay now,its good way, when u want to buy, but don't have in cash. Fortuno doesn't work too for me because they provide for only one phone company

comments.author: rat03gopoh
comments.body: Quote from: Debilsumda on January 21, 2023, 04:03:05 PM~How about https://www.dimoco-payments.com ? they are also partnered with coingate. (I haven't tried this, DWYOR)Haven't figured out what causes the service to no longer work. If it's coingate's policy, there's the possibility of being constrained by the single regulation of payment services on the Continent. idk, try to find out more, maybe coingate has announced something about this on their social media.
